messages.content:
### FAQ for X1000

**Q1: Why does my X1000 overheat?**
A: Overheating can occur if the device is used in temperatures above 35 °C, if ventilation is blocked, or if dust builds up on the intake filters. A firmware bug may also cause excess heat, which is fixed in the latest update.

**Q2: How can I prevent my X1000 from overheating?**
A: • Keep the device on a hard, flat surface (metal works best).
• Ensure the vents are clear and clean any dust from the filters regularly.
• Avoid using the device in direct sunlight or on soft surfaces.
• Use a cooling pad if you need extended heavy usage.
• Check that the firmware is up‑to‑date.
